meanings.sent1: The pinked fabric had tiny holes all over it.
meanings.sent2: She wore a pinked dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The pinked paper looked like it had been visited by a hole puncher.
meanings.sent4: The pinked design on the wall added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The pinked edges of the invitation made it stand out from the rest.

meanings.sent1: He pinked the paper with a sharp tool.
meanings.sent2: The tailor pinked the fabric before sewing it.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally pinked her finger while trying to make holes.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops pinked the surface of the lake as they fell.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully pinked the canvas to create a unique texture.

meanings.definition: To decorate with a perforated pattern.
meanings.sent1: She pinked the edges of the card for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman pinked the leather to add a stylish detail.
meanings.sent3: The chef pinked the pie crust for a fancy presentation.
meanings.sent4: The designer pinked the fabric to give it a modern look.
meanings.sent5: The gardener pinked the garden fence for a whimsical feel.
